thread.title: Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera out to KO rivals Liverpool from the Champions League race

author: ashilton
title: Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera out to KO rivals Liverpool from the Champions League race

organizations.name: tag heuer manchester united watch collection

text:
RIGHT ANDER Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera out to KO rivals Liverpool from the Champions League race 
A 15-game unbeaten run in the Premier League has left them just a point behind freefalling and fifth-placed Liverpool By NEIL CUSTIS Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE title might be gone for Manchester United, but bragging rights over their bitterest rivals are still up for grabs. 
And that is motivating the Red Devils in the Premier League right now — as well as the prospect of a return to the Champions League . Getty Images 5 Passionate Herrera is desperate was United to get bragging rights over their rivals 
A 15-game unbeaten run in the league has left them just a point behind fifth placed Liverpool who are in free fall while Manchester City are just four points ahead of them in third. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Now midfielder Ander Herrera says the players are determined to overhaul them both to give their fans something to shout about. 
Herrera said: “I cannot lie, for our fans it would be special to finish above them. 
“We believe in our qualities and we can do it.” 
Having finished fourth and fifth in the last two seasons United might appear to be going backwards having been sixth now for 67 days. 
But they are still fighting on three fronts in the Cups and the style of play under Jose Mourinho has also brought an air of positivity back to the club not just for the fans but the players too. PA:Press Association Herrera helped United to a comofrtable win over Leicester last weekend Getty Images Herrera celebrates Wayne Rooney’s 250th Man United goal with the man himself Leicester 0-3 Manchester United : Mkhitaryan, Ibrahimovic and Mata finish off Foxes 
Herrera said: “I cannot lie. This is the time I am enjoying most at Man United. 
“When we are on the pitch you can recognise a big team playing. 
“OK, sometimes we don’t win but we are always the protagonist team, we are always getting more chances than the opponent. 
“Almost always we have had more possession than our opponents. Normally the best player of the opposition is the goalkeeper so that shows we are a big team.” 
Herrera is something of a fan favourite and he in turn loves it at Manchester United. Related stories GLOVES ARE OFF David de Gea and Thibaut Courtois locked in battle to replace Keylor Navas as Real Madrid No1 WE WANT MOUR OF YOU Jose Mourinho will talk with Man Utd at the end of the season over a one-year contract extension hart take Arsenal join the race for £15million Joe Hart as Arsene Wenger eyes up a replacement for Petr Cech CONFIRM OR DENY Max Allegri fuels Arsenal speculation despite Juve GM telling Gunners 'there's no reason to leave' Jack of no clubs Jack Wilshere faces crisis as 'Cherries unlikely to buy him and Arsenal cannot ensure first-team football' NIFTY SHADES OF GRAY Leicester 3 Derby 1 (AET): Demarai Gray sends Foxes to FA Cup fifth round to ease some of the pressure on Claudio Ranieri REDS ALERT Adam Lallana 'set to MISS Liverpool's crucial showdown with Tottenham after not training all week' VAN PARKED Virgil van Dijk set to sensationally snub mega-money move to Prem giants and STAY at Southampton BLOOMING AWFUL BBC pundits slam Leicester and Derby after 18 changes made for dreadful FA Cup showcase DEPAYET GOALS Premier League misfits Dimitri Payet and Memphis Depay score first goals in Ligue 1 READY, STEADY, COOK Man City's kids know how to stick it in the onion bag.. and plenty of other kitchen skills as well HISTORY MAKERS Alaves 1 Celta Vigo 0: Babazorros reach Copa del Rey final for first time in 96-year history after late winner 
He has 18 months left of his present deal which also has the option of a further year. 
There has been no talk yet of triggering that. 
He said: “Of course, if they want to talk with me, I will be very happy to do that.” 
Herrera’s form has also been recognised by his country now although his first call up to the squad last October took him by surprise so much so that he didn’t have his boots. 
He said: “Yeah. I was in Madrid, Saul Niguez got injured and I was called up. News Group Newspapers Ltd Herrera faced England in a friendly back in November Reuters 5 And Herrera proved his was no shrinking violet on his international debut 
“I was with my girlfriend and the baby. We had three days off, to have a bit of sun. 
“But they called me and I didn’t have my boots, so my friend did me a favour and went to buy some. 
“It is a funny story and I will never forget it.” 
The serious business resumes on Saturday with United taking on Watford at home ahead of the resumption of their cup exploits in the Europa League against St Etienne next Thursday. 
Herrera said: “It is time to get more trophies for the club. Three competitions to fight for and in the Premier League we have to finish in the top four.” 
And for Herrera, to be in their above Liverpool and City will of course make it extra special. Ander Herrera was speaking at the unveiling of the TAG Heuer Manchester United Watch Collection. The new TAG Heuer special edition Manchester United watches will be sold at the Manchester United Megastore boutique as well as selected TAG Heuer retailers. The collection is also available online at www.store.manutd.com Jesse Lingard reveals Manchester United teammate Paul Pogba is ALWAYS late for training
